name: repark
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
to park a vehicle again, either in a different place or in a different position: He reparked the car, taking care to point it downhill. A police officer came over and asked us to re-park the truck on a side street.
More examplesFewer examplesAirport personnel will be available to re-park planes where necessary.He left the office to repark the car in a safer place, only to find it had been stolen.Someone re-parked my wheelchair in front of the air conditioning and I sat and shivered for hours.
